question_text: How does doubling the number of memory channels affect theoretical memory bandwidth?
answer_options: It halves the total latency across modules
It has no effect unless CPU clock speed is also doubled
It doubles the memory bandwidth available to the CPU
correct_answer: It doubles the memory bandwidth available to the CPU
explanation: Adding memory channels allows the CPU to read/write data to multiple modules simultaneously, effectively doubling available bandwidth in a dual-channel configuration.
